summary:
The Security Council,
Recalling previous resolutions on Western Sahara,
Reaffirming support for the Secretary-General's efforts,
Seeking a just, lasting and mutually acceptable solution for self-determination,
Calls for cooperation to end the impasse,
 Notes Moroccan and Polisario Front proposals,
 Welcoming progress in direct negotiations,
 
1. Reaffirms ceasefire agreements with MINURSO,
2. Urges parties to show political will for dialogue,
3. Calls for negotiations without preconditions and in good faith,
4. Invites Member States to assist talks,
5. Requests a report by 31 January 2008 on negotiations,
6. Requests a report on the situation before the end of MINURSO's mandate,
7. Calls for voluntary contributions for Confidence Building Measures,
8. Extends MINURSO's mandate until 30 April 2008,
9. Ensures compliance with UN zero-tolerance policy on sexual exploitation,
10. Remains seized of the matter.
